description: The highest peak in Karnataka (1950 meters) and a top destination for trekking and sunset views. It offers panoramic vistas of the Western Ghats.
A sacred mountain range revered by both Hindus and Muslims. It is famous for its shrine, caves, and scenic trekking trails.
A popular vantage point offering breathtaking views of the lush green valleys. It involves a short, scenic trek from Kemmanagundi Raj Bhavan.
A spectacular peak shaped like a horse's face, offering one of the most scenic treks in the region through rolling hills and shola forests.
A magnificent two-tiered waterfall cascading from 168 meters (551 ft) inside a coffee estate. Accessible via a thrilling jeep ride and a short trek.
Known as 'Buttermilk Falls' for its white, frothy appearance, this waterfall is set amidst dense forests and coffee plantations.
A unique waterfall that cascades over the Veerabhadra Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is a site of both natural beauty and spiritual significance.
One of the four cardinal peethams established by Adi Shankaracharya in the 8th century. The Vidyashankara Temple here is an architectural marvel blending Hoysala and Dravidian styles.
A famous temple dedicated to Goddess Annapoorna (Goddess of Food) located on the banks of the Bhadra River. It is renowned for offering free meals to all devotees.
A masterpiece of Hoysala architecture from the 12th century, famous for its intricate stone carvings and sculptures. A UNESCO World Heritage nomination.
Run by the Coffee Board of India, this museum offers an in-depth journey into the history, cultivation, and processing of coffee.
Guided walks through lush Arabica and Robusta plantations to learn about bean-to-cup processes, often ending with fresh coffee tasting.
A designated Tiger Reserve (Project Tiger) known for its rich population of tigers, leopards, and over 250 bird species. Offers jeep safaris for wildlife spotting.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its biodiversity, shola grasslands, and wet evergreen forests.
A beautiful man-made lake surrounded by mountains and coffee plantations, famous for its stunning sunset views.
The second largest lake in Karnataka, offering serene views with the Baba Budangiri range in the backdrop.
Ruins of a 12th-century Hoysala fort located atop a hill, accessible via a scenic trek through dense forests.
